input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5째C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.
 Floor 2:
This floor is dedicated to house the building's maintenance and engineering team, ensuring the smooth operation of the skyscraper's systems. The floor plan includes a large workshop area, storage rooms for spare parts, and a break room for team members. The design prioritizes functionality and efficiency, with ample natural light and ergonomic workstations.
 Floor 3:
This floor is designated for the building's security team, featuring a control room with advanced surveillance systems and communication equipment. The team is responsible for the safety and security of the building and its occupants, ensuring a secure environment for all.
 Floor 4:
This floor is dedicated to the building's mailroom and package delivery services, providing a convenient and efficient solution for the delivery and pickup of mail and packages for tenants. The design includes multiple lockers for secure package storage and a dedicated work area for mailroom staff.
 Floor 5:
This floor is allocated for a high-end restaurant, offering tenants and visitors an exquisite dining experience. The restaurant features an open kitchen concept, allowing diners to observe the chefs at work. The design includes a spacious dining area, private dining rooms, and a bar area.
 Floor 6:
This floor is designated for a luxury spa and wellness center, providing tenants and visitors with a range of rejuvenating treatments and services. The spa includes a relaxation lounge, treatment rooms, a sauna, and a steam room. The design prioritizes tranquility and relaxation, with soothing colors and natural materials.
 Floor 7:
This floor is allocated for a state-of-the-art conference center, featuring multiple meeting rooms and event spaces. The design includes advanced audiovisual equipment, high-speed internet connectivity, and catering services. The conference center is ideal for hosting corporate events, training sessions, and other professional gatherings.
 Floor 8:
This floor is designated for a high-end fitness center, offering tenants and visitors a comprehensive workout experience. The fitness center includes a cardio room, weight training area, yoga and Pilates studio, and a locker room with showers. The design prioritizes functionality and style, with modern equipment and sleek, contemporary design elements.
 Floor 9:
This floor is allocated for a childcare center, providing tenants with convenient and high-quality childcare services. The childcare center includes multiple play areas, a quiet room for naps, and a kitchen area for preparing meals. The design prioritizes safety and security, with a secure entrance and CCTV monitoring.
 Floor 10:
This floor is designated for a housekeeping and laundry services, providing tenants with a convenient and efficient solution for maintaining their living spaces. The design includes multiple laundry rooms, ironing facilities, and storage areas for cleaning supplies.
 Floor 11:

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The shrimp are succulent and sweet, while the cocktail sauce adds a tangy, spicy kick.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavor of the mushrooms is beautifully complemented by the savory, aromatic cheese filling.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The rich, velvety sauce clings to the tender lobster meat, creating a luxurious and indulgent dish.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The crispy skin gives way to juicy, flavorful meat, while the sweet orange glaze adds a delightful contrast.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The subtle garlic flavor adds depth and complexity to the classic dish, making it a perfect accompaniment to the rich main courses.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The glaze adds a touch of sweetness and a beautiful sheen to the carrots, making them a delightful and colorful addition to the meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The velvety texture and intense chocolate flavor make this a decadent and indulgent dessert that is sure to satisfy any sweet tooth.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee-infused ladyfingers are soft and spongey, while the creamy mascarpone cheese adds a rich, velvety texture.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. Our sommelier will be happy to help you choose the perfect pairing for your meal.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both comforting and nourishing, perfect for the cold winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Tomato Soup: A classic, hearty tomato soup served with a grilled cheese sandwich. The rich, savory soup is the perfect base for the gooey, melted cheese and crispy bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, artichokes, and a blend of cheeses. Served with warm pita bread, it's a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Stroganoff: Tender strips of beef cooked in a rich, savory sauce with mushrooms, onions, and sour cream. Served over egg noodles, it's a hearty and comforting dish.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A classic comfort food dish featuring tender chicken, vegetables, and a flaky, buttery crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy mashed sweet potatoes seasoned with a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. The subtle sweetness and warm spices make this a delicious and comforting side dish.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Crispy green beans tossed in a buttery almond sauce. The crunchy almonds add texture and flavor to the tender green beans.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tart apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Chocolate Cake: A rich, decadent chocolate cake topped with a creamy chocolate frosting.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A warm, rich, and indulgent hot chocolate made with real chocolate and milk.
5.2) Mulled Wine: A festive and warming drink made with red wine, spices, and fruit.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week, we celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' with a special Grilled Salmon dish.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: Fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil drizzled with balsamic glaze. The sweet, juicy tomatoes, creamy mozzarella, and fragrant basil make for a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with a tomato, garlic, and basil mixture. The crispy bread, savory tomatoes, and fragrant basil make for a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection and served with a lemon butter sauce. The tender, juicy salmon is complemented by the tangy, buttery sauce.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, vegetables, and a citrus vinaigrette.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled to perfection and seasoned with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3.2) Quinoa Pilaf: A flavorful pilaf made with quinoa, vegetables, and herbs.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy, sweet lemon tart with a crispy, buttery crust.
4.2) Fresh Fruit Salad: A colorful and refreshing fruit salad made with a variety of seasonal fruits.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp, refreshing white wine to complement the light, refreshing flavors of the meal.
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing, cooling iced tea to quench your thirst.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both hearty and flavorful, perfect for a cozy dinner at home.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Stuffed Jalapeno Peppers: Jalapeno peppers stuffed with a savory cheese and breadcrumb mixture, baked until golden. The spicy peppers are balanced by the rich, savory filling.
1.2) Spinach and Feta Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, feta cheese, and a hint of garlic. Served with pita chips, it's a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French dish featuring tender beef, mushrooms, onions, and a rich, flavorful red wine sauce.
2.2) Chicken Parmesan: Breaded and fried chicken cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized. The natural sweetness of the vegetables is enhanced by the roasting process.
3.2) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The subtle garlic flavor adds depth and complexity to the classic dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Brownies: Rich, fudgy chocolate brownies topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tart apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A bold, flavorful red wine to complement the rich, savory flavors of the meal.
5.2) Milkshake: A creamy, indulgent milkshake made with your choice of ice cream flavor.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both comforting and delicious, perfect for a cozy dinner at home.
1. Appetizers:

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 02-02 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-11 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.5 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 32 to Week 35 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and warming, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with a crunchy streusel topping.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A rich, nutty pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, comforting drink made with rich chocolate and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for those looking to start the year off on a healthy note.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with salt, served as a tasty and healthy snack.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Salad: A light and healthy salad made with grilled chicken, mixed greens, and a tangy vinaigrette.
2.2) Quinoa Bowl: A hearty and nutritious bowl made with quinoa, roasted vegetables, and a protein of your choice.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled to perfection and seasoned with olive oil and salt.
3.2) Brown Rice: A nutritious and flavorful side dish made with brown rice and a hint of saffron.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Fresh Fruit Salad: A colorful and refreshing dessert made with a variety of seasonal fruits.
4.2) Sorbet: A light and refreshing dessert made with natural fruit flavors and a touch of sweetness.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Green Tea: A healthy and refreshing beverage made with antioxidant-rich green tea.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A calorie-free and refreshing drink to quench your thirst.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features dishes that are spicy and bold, perfect for those who enjoy a little heat in their meals.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Jalapeno Poppers: Spicy jalapeno peppers stuffed with cream cheese and breadcrumbs, baked until golden.
1.2) Spicy Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with chili flakes and soy sauce, served as a tasty and spicy snack.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chili Con Carne: A hearty and spicy stew made with ground beef, kidney beans, and a variety of chili peppers.
2.2) Pad Thai: A classic Thai dish made with rice noodles, vegetables, and a spicy peanut sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Rice: A flavorful and spicy side dish made with rice, vegetables, and your choice of protein.
3.2) Spicy Coleslaw: A tangy and spicy twist on the classic coleslaw, made with jalapeno peppers and a spicy dressing.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chili Chocolate Cake: A rich and decadent cake made with chili peppers and dark chocolate.
4.2) Mango Sorbet: A sweet and refreshing dessert made with ripe mangoes and a hint of chili pepper for a spicy kick.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Margarita: A classic Mexican cocktail made with tequila, lime juice, and a salted rim.
5.2) Spicy Ginger Ale: A bold and spicy twist on the classic ginger ale, made with ginger and chili peppers.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
This week's menu features dishes that are comforting and cozy, perfect for those cold winter nights.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Cheese and Charcuterie Board: A selection of artisanal cheeses, cured meats, and crackers, served with a variety of accompaniments.
1.2) Tomato Soup: A classic and comforting soup made with fresh tomatoes, onions, and a hint of sugar.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Stroganoff: A rich and hearty dish made with beef, mushrooms, sour cream, and egg noodles.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting and savory dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Soup and Salad Midweek.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichoke hearts, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Alfredo: Tender chicken breast smothered in a creamy Alfredo sauce, served over pasta.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese baked to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Caesar Salad: Romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.
3.2) Minestrone Soup: A hearty vegetable soup filled with beans, pasta, and vegetables.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm, sweet dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Cheesecake: A rich, velvety cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and a tangy lemon topping.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the savory flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Lemonade: A refreshing, tangy lemonade to complement the lighter flavors of the appetizers and salads.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with tomatoes, garlic, basil, and mozzarella.
1.2) Crab Cakes: Delicate crab cakes made with jumbo lump crab meat, served with a tangy remoulade sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French dish made with tender beef, red wine, onions, carrots, and mushrooms.
2.2) Vegetarian Paella: A flavorful Spanish rice dish filled with vegetables, saffron, and paprika.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Green Beans Almondine: Crispy green beans coated in a browned butter and almond sauce.
3.2) Garlic Roasted Potatoes: Roasted potatoes tossed in garlic and olive oil, served crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
4. Desserts:

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and warming, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with a crispy crumb topping.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A rich, nutty pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, comforting drink made with rich chocolate and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for those looking to detox after the holiday season.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
